title: If no diesel supply by tonight, container transportation may come to standstill: Assn.
body_lines: If there is no plan to supply fuel by midnight today, it will directly affect the container transportation, All Island United Container Transport Owners' Association (AIUCTOA) today said
AIUCTOA Head, Sahan Manjula told the Daily Mirror that due to the lack of diesel for container hauling prime movers, import and export container transport is restricted.
Inability to continue container transportation will make direct impact on the import/export revenue and thereby hamper the inflow of the most important foreign exchange, he said.
He said the Ports Authority Chairman and the director general have been informed about this, but no tangible action has so far been taken. (Chaturanga Samarawickrama)
